trans-unit.source: Implements the basic functionality common to control arrays in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
You do not typically inherit from `BaseControlArray`.
To create your own control array, inherit from one of the control array classes in the `Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6` namespace.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray"></xref> class.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this constructor is typically not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray"></xref> class, optionally specifying a container.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this constructor is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> where the control array will be hosted.
Gets a value that indicates whether a control is a member of a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this `Protected` method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> to test.
`true` if the control is a member of the control array; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the index of a control in a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this `Protected` method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which you want to retrieve the index.
A `Short` integer representing the index of the control in the control array.
Gets the control for a specified index in a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this `Protected` method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
An integer that represents the index of the control in the control array.
The at the specified Index.
Not supported in the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray"></xref> class.
This method is not supported.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref>.
Sets the index for a control in a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this `Protected` method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> for which you want to set the index.
A `Short` integer that represents the index for the control.
Optional.
A `Boolean` specifying whether the control was created at design time (`false`) or at run time (`true`).
Returns a value that indicates whether a control is a member of a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this `Protected` method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref>.
`true` if the control is a member of the control array; otherwise, `false`.
Stores the container for a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Stores values to track whether a control in a control array was created at design time or at run time.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Stores values that represent the controls in a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Returns the number of controls in a control array.
You can use this property in a [For...Next Statement](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/statements/for-next-statement.md) to perform an operation on the controls in a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A Short that contains the number of controls.
Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by a control in a control array and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the disposing parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with the disposing parameter set to `false`.
When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this control references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Stores a value indicating whether the initialization code for a control array's container has finished executing.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Returns the type of a control in a control array.
This method must be overridden.
The <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray"></xref> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.
Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this `Protected` method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Functions and objects in the <xref href="Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6"></xref> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Returns a reference to an enumerator object, which is used to iterate over a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object.
Adds event handlers for a control in a control array.
This method must be overridden.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref>.
Stores the indices for a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Returns a `Short` that contains the smallest available subscript for a control array.
The `LBound` function is used with the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.UBound%2A> function to determine the size of a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Short` that contains the lower bounds of a control array.
Creates a new element in a control array.
This method is the equivalent of the Visual Basic 6.0 `Load` function for dynamically creating a new control array element.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Short` that represents the index of the new control.
Returns a `Short` that contains the largest available subscript for a control array.
The `UBound` function is used with the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.LBound%2A> function to determine the size of a control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Short` that contains the upper bounds of a control array.
Removes a control from a control array.
This method is the equivalent of the Visual Basic 6.0 `Unload` function for dynamically removing a control array element.
Only controls that were added dynamically by using the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.Load%2A> method can be removed from the control array.
The <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray> class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
A `Short` that represents the index of the control to remove.
Begins the initialization of the control.
Design environments typically use this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component.
The <xref:MMicrosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#EndInit%2A> method ends the initialization.

Using the `BeginInit` and <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#EndInit*> methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.
The initialization occurs at run time.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
Ends the initialization of a control.
Design environments typically use this method to finish the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component.
The `EndInit` method ends the initialization.

Using the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.System#ComponentModel#ISupportInitialize#BeginInit> and `EndInit` methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.
The initialization occurs at run time.

Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to [!INCLUDE[vbprvb](~/includes/vbprvb-md.md)].
In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.
